p:
Given the profound interest in Mn complexes as electrocatalysts for O 2 reduction
5 c,14
and the single report on the use of the BQ/H 2Q redox couple in tandem with a molecular electrocatalyst to facilitate O 2 reduction,
8 b
we sought to carry out a study on the co-electrocatalytic competency of hydrogen-bonded qunione anions using a Mn-based catalyst developed in our lab.
15 This molecular Mn complex, Mn(
tbu dhbpy)Cl 1, where 6,6′-di(3,5-di- tert-butyl-2-phenolate)-2,2′-bipyridine = [
tbu dhbpy] 2−, is a competent catalyst for the selective reduction of O 2 to H 2O 2 ( ca. 80% selectivity) in the presence of weak Brønsted acids (phenol derivatives and TFEOH). Herein, we report the selective electrocatalytic reduction of O 2 to H 2O (96 ± 0.5%) by a catalyst system comprised of Mn(
tbu dhbpy)Cl 1, p-benzoquinone (BQ), and TFEOH as a sacrificial proton donor ( Fig. 1). We note that the computationally estimated p K a of TFEOH in MeCN is 35.4.
16
